ratings.comment: The more you put in, the more you'll get out. She likes it when people participate and it definitely helps your grade if you do. Very nice woman and very respectable. Make sure you do the readings
Best Spanish teacher I've ever had. She cares about her students and helps everyone succeed. She's very funny and makes class entertaining too.

She is a nice professor; however, it seems hard to get above an AB in the class. Participation and attendance are a huge part of the grade. There are only 5 short essays and 3 longer papers assigned, so the class is not stressful.

Adriana is easily the best professor I've had at Madison. She's extremely funny and down-to-earth. She also really knows her stuff and is great at explaining concepts. If you likeare good at Spanish, this class with her will be easy. No exams, just papers!

Adriana is easily the best professor I have ever had. She is extremely funny and down-to-earth. She also really knows her stuff and can explain concepts clearly. If you're interested ingood at Spanish, this class with her won't be difficult for you. No exams, just papers!

Honestly such a sweet lady. She is willing to help and although there were a lot of difficulties this semester in the structure of the class, those should be blamed on the course coordinator, not Adriana. She did her best for the tough and confusing pace at which the class moved.
She was the best TA out of all of them. She's the head TA so she knows her stuff. Her tests weren't easy, but they were a good preparation for the final and the mid-term. She graded fairly, too.

Adriana is charismatic, fun, and a great teacher. I feel like I have a better grasp on Spanish than kids who had other TAs. However, it was nearly impossible to get an A in this class with her as the teacher. She is picky and expects a lot. Students with other TAs seemed to have no trouble getting an A.

One of the hardest Spanish teachers.  I hated going to class and Spanish is something I am really interested in but having her as a teacher was not a good experience for me.  I had trouble with the grammar and felt she didn't explain it well. All of the tests are extremely difficult.
Adriana is great. While the class wasn't particularly easy, she was extremely helpful, cheerful, and made certain everybody understood the material.
Adriana is the hardest 203 professor. She is very dedicated and helpful though, and makes spanish very interesting.

I took the Business spanish and it was amazing.  Not your conventional "now get in a group and say pointless sentences!" you read really interesting lectures.  She's kind of tough but really interesting and very personable.  I loved being in her class and if you're willing to put in the effort, you should be bale to get a good grade.

i love her.she is such a cool and down to earth TA.not an easy A, but not hard either.i didn't try and got a B, but avg was prolly B-AB. yea but i love her. she's real nice; cares about her work (and students). class is kinda fun. very nice. oh, and not a lot of work. maybe 3 hrs/week. id take again
She is an amazing teacher; very friendly, nice, and helpful throughout the course
